content: if you would like a wider or narrower neckline adjust the st count accordingly on the other side k54 cast off 42sts and then slip the knitted sts from the right needle back onto the left needle now use the 3 needle bind off method to cast off both sleeves separately  the 3rd way takes a while but looks the nicest do the same as for the 2nd method but instead of the 3 needle bind off graft the sts together with the kitchener stitch method 3  once you have joined the sleeve seams place your top flat with right sides facing on the bottom edge stitch each side from cuff in towards centre approx 15cm this forms the sleeves these seams are shown in red in the diagram bellow top edge bottom edge  block your garment by soaking in water gently squeezing out the excess and laying flat on a towel to dry make sure the top is nice and straight before drying all my patterns are tested and checked before publication please let me know if there is anything in the above information that is either not clear or which you feel might be an error text photography and design copyright© sian price-white 2014 all rights reserved reproduction in whole or any part of all material is strictly forbidden no part of this publication may be reproduced or transmitted without prior permission in writing reproduction of this publication is protected by copyright and may be used for non-commercial purposes only this knit design is protected by copyright 4
